page.title: 03Dilhorne Endowed School cont
page.content: In 1952 Government reorganisation resulted in the school becoming part of an"AIDED" school under the umbrella of the Church of England. This is true of many school in this area of North Staffordshire. The Trust know pays annually into the Barchester Scheme.This scheme provides for the repair of the exteria of the school. The L.E.A. being reponsible for the staffing and repairs to the interia of the school. There was much discussion over this change for although originally a church based foundation, the village over the years was influenced greatly by the Methodist tradition.Today both aid and encourage the school in its work. The numbers of children,aged 4 to 11 years have fallen to 34,but the school provides a varied eduaction.
